importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the incident and the subsequent police report, which occurred on October 19, 2025, is central to understanding the timeline of events and public response.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time of the report's publication and the timing of the crash, which occurred on Saturday, aligns with the urgent response and public awareness of the event.

keyTakeAways: A vehicle plowed into a birthday party tent in Bladensburg, Maryland, killing one person and injuring 13, including six adults and eight children aged 1 to 17.
The driver, a 66-year-old man from Washington, DC, initially fled the scene on foot but later turned himself in.
The deceased was identified as Ashley Hernandez Gutierrez, 31, of Washington.
Neighbors reported hearing loud booms and saw a car driving erratically before the crash, with multiple children injured and one child in stable condition in the hospital.
The incident occurred in Bladensburg, a neighborhood in Prince George’s County, Maryland, near Washington, DC.

Former school board member and Bladensburg council member Jocelyn Route witnessed the crash and described the scene, including emergency personnel working to resuscitate the victim and injured children.
A video posted on X (formerly Twitter) shows police and firefighters at the scene, with the tent torn open and partially collapsed.
All victims were taken to hospitals; three adults remain in stable condition, one is awaiting treatment, and one has been released. One child remains in stable condition.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is the only fatality in the incident and central to the human impact and identification of the event.

namedEntities.name: Jocelyn Route

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She provided firsthand eyewitness testimony of the crash, describing the scene and contributing to public awareness and accountability.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The location is key to understanding the geography and local context of the incident and community response.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It indicates the cross-county nature of the incident, linking a DC resident to a Maryland community event, and raises questions about regional traffic or safety regulations.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It provides jurisdictional context and shows the local governance structure involved in the incident's response and oversight.

namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Driver who caused the crash and fled initially before turning himself in
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the central figure in the criminal investigation and public concern over road safety and driver accountability.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A car plowed into a birthday party tent in Bladensburg, Maryland, killing 31-year-old Ashley Hernandez Gutierrez and injuring 13 people, including six adults and eight children. The driver, a 66-year-old Washington, DC, man, initially fled the scene on foot but later turned himself in. Witnesses, including former Bladensburg council member Jocelyn Route, reported hearing loud noises and seeing a car driving erratically. The scene was captured in a video posted on X, showing police and fire crews responding. All victims were taken to hospitals, with three adults in stable condition, one awaiting treatment, and one released. One child remains in stable condition. Criminal charges are pending against the driver, and the incident has sparked public concern about road safety and driver behavior, especially in residential areas.
title: Driver plows into child’s birthday party in Maryland, killing 1 and injuring 13, turns himself in
